Meet Your Faculty Mohamed Helmy Principal Scientist and Adjunct Professor Vaccine and Infectious Disease Organization (VIDO), University of Saskatchewan Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada mohamed.helmy@usask.ca Mohamed is a Computational Systems Biologist and Principal Scientist leading the Bioinformatics and Systems Biology Lab (BSBL) at the Vaccine and Infectious Disease Organization (VIDO), University of Saskatchewan. He received his MSc and PhD in Computational Systems Biology from Keio University (Tokyo, Japan) and completed his postdoctoral training in bioinformatics at Kyoto University and the University of Toronto. Mohamed’s interdisciplinary research profile bridges biology, computer science, and public health. Sylvia Li Graduate student Vaccine and Infectious Disease Organization (VIDO), University of Saskatchewan Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada Sylvia is a Computer science MSc student at the University of Saskatchewan, supervised by Dr. Helmy. She holds dual BSc degrees in Bioinformatics and Computer science. Currently her work focuses on bacterial genomic data. Data and Compute Setup Course data downloads Coming soon!
